    • Uses of Agent in physicalLayer

      Subclasses of Agent in physicalLayer 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  SocialActionAgent
      An implementation of the Agent abstract class capable of social action, where social action is operationalised as: goal-rational action, where the action taken is considered to be the most likely to achieve a goal; traditional action, where the action taken is comparable to the representative state of the population at the current timestep; random action, where the action taken is completely random. A SocialActionAgent is situated in an environment, that has a two-layered neural network architecture for learning and decision-making.
      Fields in physicalLayer with type parameters of type Agent 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Agent> PhysicalLayer.agents
      A collection storing the agents in the environment.
      Methods in physicalLayer that return Agent 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Agent SocialActionAgent.produceOffspring(Agent other)
      Creates a new offspring based on this and another Agent, with no initial location.
      abstract Agent Agent.produceOffspring(Agent other)
      Creates a new offspring based on this and another Agent, with no initial location.
      Agent SocialActionAgent.produceTraditionalOffspring(java.util.ArrayList<double[][][]> genes)
      Creates a new offspring with no initial location, which is a representative state of the population at the current timestep, using the median weights across all agents in the population.
      abstract Agent Agent.produceTraditionalOffspring(java.util.ArrayList<double[][][]> genes)
      Creates a new offspring with no initial location, which is a representative state of the population at the current timestep.
